description: The Merlion is the national personification of Singapore. Its name combines "mer" meaning the sea and "lion". The fish body represents Singapore origin as a fishing village when it was called "Temasek", which means "Sea Town" in Javanese. The lion head represents Singapore original name "Singapura" meaning "lion city" or "kota singa"
